abstract.para: When &slea; boots, network interface names are assigned. There are several strategies for assembling the interface names, mainly based on information obtained by probing network hardware devices. For security and administration purposes, it is crucial that the network interface names are predictable and persist system reboots and hardware changes. &systemd; together with udev rules introduce such stable and customizable naming scheme.

topic.para: The following procedure describes steps to disable the predictable naming scheme if you had previously enabled it and now have decided to revert to the traditional naming scheme.

step.para: Recover or create your own network interface naming scheme under /etc/udev/rules.d/, or reinstall the biosdevname package.
Start the &yast; Boot Loader module, delete net.ifnames=1 if present, and append net.ifnames=0 to the kernel command line. Confirm with OK.
